avalancheActivity.comment:
A lot of new snow at low altitude: The moderate wind has transported the new snow significantly. The fresh wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach large size. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on steep slopes above the tree line.
In particular on steep shady slopes avalanches can be released in deep layers of the snowpack.
As a consequence of solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m, and in steep rocky terrain.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised in particular on steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 25 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. The new snow and wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack above the tree line. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. On Friday medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes moderate wind has transported the new snow. The large wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can in some cases penetrate deep layers and reach large size.
As a consequence of solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m, and in steep rocky terrain.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack can indicate the danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: 10 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. The new snow and wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack above the tree line. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes moderate wind has transported the new snow significantly. The large wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can also penetrate deep layers and reach large size.
Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack can indicate the danger.
As a consequence of solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m, and in steep rocky terrain.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: 15 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. Since Wednesday on steep shady slopes numerous medium-sized to large avalanches were released. The new snow and wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack above the tree line. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment: The sometimes moderate wind has transported the new snow. This snow as well as the wind slabs to be found above the tree line represent the main danger. The wind slabs are quite large can be released easily, especially on very steep slopes at intermediate and high altitudes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. As a consequence of solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m, and in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
25 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: The sometimes moderate wind has transported the new snow. This snow as well as the wind slabs to be found above the tree line represent the main danger. The wind slabs are quite large can be released easily, especially on very steep slopes at intermediate and high altitudes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. As a consequence of solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m, and in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
